alert.note: Alert for Clay; Effingham (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 2:36AM CDT until August 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following counties, Clay and Effingham. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain will continue through early morning, and may be locally heavy at times. Any additional flood risk would be most prominent where heavy rain fell overnight, primarily across Effingham and far northern Clay Counties.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
